Class P_HomeUI

java.lang.Object
boundary.user.patient.P_HomeUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUserInterface
public class P_HomeUI extends Object implements IUserInterface
The `P_HomeUI` class represents the user interface for a patient's home screen in a healthcare system. It implements the `IUserInterface` interface and provides various methods for the patient to interact with their appointments, view notifications, make payments, and more. This class handles operations such as scheduling, rescheduling, canceling appointments, viewing past appointments, viewing and paying invoices, and viewing notifications. It interacts with controllers for managing appointments, invoices, notifications, and user sessions. It also provides methods to select dates, display doctor information, and handle payments for outstanding balances. The patient interacts with this interface through various menu options that invoke these actions.

  • Constructor Details

    • P_HomeUI

      public P_HomeUI(SessionManager session)
      Constructs a P_HomeUI instance to handle patient user interface actions. Initializes the session and notification controller for the patient.
      Parameters:
      session - the session manager to handle the current user session

  • Method Details

    • show_options

      public void show_options()
      Displays the main menu options for the patient interface. Provides options like viewing medical records, updating information, scheduling appointments, etc.
      Specified by:
      show_options in interface IUserInterface

    • handle_option

      public void handle_option(int choice)
      Handles the selected menu option by invoking the corresponding method. Each case corresponds to a specific patient action, such as viewing medical records or scheduling an appointment.
      Specified by:
      handle_option in interface IUserInterface
      Parameters:
      choice - the menu option selected by the patient

    • viewNotifications

      public void viewNotifications()
      Displays and marks all notifications as read.
